title: kreosan
author: kreosan
created_time: March 01, 2025, 09:50:51 AMLast edit: March 07, 2025, 05:24:28 PM by kreosan
content: A fully formed sequential group of blocks secp256k1 is for sale, where A...F are private keys (pk), G...J are public keys part 1 (gx), and K...L are public keys part 2 (gy).  Group of blocks are formed sequentially with odd 'A' at an interval of 1. Total number of blocks: 50. Price: 1 BTC.  There is also the possibility to form the entire block based on a single private key (0.02 BTC per block) or any single public key without private keys (0.01 BTC per block).  Demo (part of the block):pk (C): 4bb7b36f21ecb0d1f022e94a4cbc0447fc8d38ecc2bcfedfbb0074f3651641bbgx (H): bfb810ded91b7b6b7b75d16d77bdaea9c058b2221581feaeb7b0e709cbc79ae3gy (K): 6a07eb895682e6fdb724888516f6bf469d9159e5f1b76a33b404dd58ddbd3bd5pk (D): b4484c90de134f2e0fdd16b5b343fbb6be21a3f9ec8ba15c04d1e9996b1fff86gx (H): bfb810ded91b7b6b7b75d16d77bdaea9c058b2221581feaeb7b0e709cbc79ae3gy (L): 95f81476a97d190248db777ae90940b9626ea61a0e4895cc4bfb22a62242c05apk (E): b369c959cdee340a885c4c47ef198513537f28a32be2c3799e3b42c4f5fac1c1gx (J): f2e25c0854a08991bf91dae028a38dbe4e35341ab8c037915f2bdd8529df8299gy (K): 6a07eb895682e6fdb724888516f6bf469d9159e5f1b76a33b404dd58ddbd3bd5pk (F): 4c9636a63211cbf577a3b3b810e67aeb672fb4438365dcc221971bc7da3b7f80gx (J): f2e25c0854a08991bf91dae028a38dbe4e35341ab8c037915f2bdd8529df8299gy (L): 95f81476a97d190248db777ae90940b9626ea61a0e4895cc4bfb22a62242c05aSingle block design:pk     gx     gy------------------A      G      KB      G      LC      H      KD      H      LE      J       KF      J       L------------------

comments.author: kTimesG
comments.body: Quote from: kreosan on March 01, 2025, 09:50:51 AMThere is also the possibility to form the entire block based on a single private key (0.2 BTC per block) or any single public key without private keys (0.05 BTC per block).  Demo (part of the block): ...Why would one pay 50 BTC for a script that simply multiplies a scalar key by lambda endomorphism, and curve point field elements by beta endomorphism (for X) and subtracts Y from field prime / negates the key?Sorry to ruin your secret.

comments.author: ekstremista
comments.body: I have absolutely no idea what is being discussed here. Somebody break it down for me dummy-style

comments.author: kreosan
comments.created_time: March 06, 2025, 07:00:11 PMLast edit: March 07, 2025, 05:26:06 PM by kreosan
comments.body: Quote from: kTimesG on March 06, 2025, 07:52:21 AMQuote from: kreosan on March 01, 2025, 09:50:51 AMThere is also the possibility to form the entire block based on a single private key (0.2 BTC per block) or any single public key without private keys (0.05 BTC per block).  Demo (part of the block): ...Why would one pay 50 BTC for a script that simply multiplies a scalar key by lambda endomorphism, and curve point field elements by beta endomorphism (for X) and subtracts Y from field prime / negates the key?Sorry to ruin your secret.Hi! Well, a full 50 BTC? That definitely wasn’t my offer )) I discovered Lambda myself without even realizing that it had already been discovered before me. )I didn’t quite understand how you use the lambda endomorphism to obtain the entire group without private keys...How about this kind of block (full with pk)?Single block design:pk       gx       gy-------------------A         27       KB         27       LC         H         KD         H        LE         J         KF         J         L-------------------27+H+J=phttps://e.radikal.host/2025/03/06/2999bdf922e54c1d3.png
